qas.question: When did North American Masonic lodges recognize members of the Prince Hall Lodge?
Who is the Prince Hall Lodge open to?

answers.text: Prince Hall is open to all men

qas.question: Does the United Grand Lodge of England recognize Prince Hall Lodges?

answers.text: The United Grand Lodge of England has no problem with recognising Prince Hall Grand Lodges

qas.question: When did North American Masonic lodges fire members of the Prince Hall Lodge?

plausible_answers.text: Prince Hall is open to all men

qas.question: Who is the Prince Hall Lodge hiding?
What lodges are no longer recognized?
What Grand Lodges require members to be black Americans?

context: Widespread segregation in 19th- and early 20th-century North America made it difficult for African-Americans to join Lodges outside of Prince Hall jurisdictions – and impossible for inter-jurisdiction recognition between the parallel U.S. Masonic authorities. <a0_0><b3_0>By the 1980s<b3_0/><a0_0/>, such discrimination was a thing of the past, and today most U.S. Grand Lodges recognise their Prince Hall counterparts, and the authorities of both traditions are working towards full recognition. <a2_0>The United Grand Lodge of England has no problem with recognising <b5_0><b6_0>Prince Hall Grand Lodges<b6_0/><b5_0/><a2_0/>. While celebrating their heritage as lodges of black Americans, <a1_0><b4_0>Prince Hall is open to all men<b4_0/><a1_0/> regardless of race or religion.
